about_the_game:
Revolution: The Spark is a narrative driven RPG with nine hand-crafted steampunk locations to explore, over 25 allies to recruit, and story choices to make that will lead to one of five possible endings.

Your path to a new revolution begins in Marble Mountains where you play as Alex, a military veteran who’s fed up with his corrupt government. Like other citizens, he struggles to make a living for his family. When his brother is kidnapped, Alex begins his quest across where the government’s ruthless dictators loom around every corner.




Recruit up to 25 allies across seven unique classes. You’ll need all the help you can get as you fight to overthrow the empress. From Workers and Guards to Bandits and Scientists, there’s a character to fit everyone’s playstyle. Be wary, not every companion gets along with each other.




Engage in strategic turn-based combat seamlessly, where you get up close to enemies or make a certain decision in dialogue. Strategize you and your allies’ next moves through a grid-based map. Keep an eye on your allies though, as once an ally is defeated, it’ll take time for them to recover.




Explore and fight your way through gorgeous cities, abandoned graveyards, decrepit caves and other gorgeous hand-drawn locations. Talk to everyone around you. Alex isn’t the only citizen upset at the government and danger lurks around every corner. You’ll never know who you meet and what secrets they’ll reveal.




Your actions will shape the outcome of the revolution. Choose how you want to approach each conflict. Will you strive to be peaceful and diplomatic, witty and cunning, or resort to violence? Every decision you make along the way will impact the world around you and unlock one of five endings.

Will you work towards a more peaceful world or keep the power for yourself? Every fire starts with a spark.

content_descriptors.notes: Several of conversations reference general mature topics, substance abuse, sex, and prostitution (nothing is ever shown directly, only implied through conversations). Conversations might contain crude, and cursing words from time to time.
